courses.title: Intro to creative tech
courses.location: 30 Macon St. (near the Nostrand A train stop)
courses.additional: Optional: we will do pickup at Compass Charter School (300 Adelphi) at 1pm, transport students safely, and take care of students until the class starts at 2pm. Cost: $16 per pickup, or $100 if paid in advance for the full 8 classes (in which case the grand total is $340).

staff.bio: Ben is a veteran developer and teacher in Brooklyn. He's taught hundreds of people to program, helped foment a revolution (ask him sometime!), and makes a mean gumbo. His work has been published in the Harvard International Review and The Best of Make Magazine, and he is totally geeking out about the phenomenal talent of the teachers below. You can see even more of his eclectic interests at techno-social.com.

Audrey is a MFA candidate in Design and Technology at Parsons in New York City. She is an experienced branding designer as well as a tech educator for children. Her current work focuses on using sensors, computer vision and Internet of Things to build multi-sensory interactive environments. See more at artificialforest.com

Ayodamola ("Ayo" for short) is an artist and interactive designer, and is currently an adjunct faculty member at The New School, Parsons School of Design. His works range from painting and speculative design to physically interactive works and explorations of Afrofuturism. See more of his work at ayo.io.

Dakota (AKA "Dakota PF") is a Brooklyn-born and -based artist. As half of LOW-RES FILMS, he directs, edits, writes and designs sound for live-action and animation films. Outside of film-making, Dakota also paints and creates digital design work, and teaches kids karate.

Taylor is a tech educator with a background in technical theatre and 3D design software. She is currently a PhD candidate at NYU Performance Studies, with a research focus in online community building. Taylor's computer course experience includes Achievement First Endeavor Middle School, NYU Magnet game center, and the Arvada Center for the Arts and Humanities.

Bryn is a data engineer at an advertising technology company and holds a Master's in Computer Science. She has prior experience teaching introductory programming courses to first year college students, but loves younger children, especially her own niece and nephew. She lives with her husband and rescue dog named Franklyn in Clinton Hill and enjoys biking and Pixar movies.

Katya is a postdoc in economics at Columbia University, an upcoming instructor at Girls Who Code in NYC 2016, akd a co-organizer of Pyladies NYC. She also volunteers as a dance teacher in Harlem schools and has danced ballet professinally. See more on her site.

Chris is an experienced game designer, web developer, and project manager that grew up in New York. He's trained and taught kung fu to people of all ages for 13 years at the USA Shaolin Temple. He also enjoys traveling and walking up mountains in the middle of the night.
